intro: Arabis hybrida, commonly known as the candytuft, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble candy drops, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and produces basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Arabis hybrida is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
